metadata.title: CVE-2018-19475 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
psi/zdevice2.c in Artifex Ghostscript before 9.26 allows remote attackersto bypass intended access restrictions because available stack space is notchecked when the device remains the same.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-19475` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ghostscript - 9.26~dfsg+0-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
ghostscript-x - 9.26~dfsg+0-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libgs9 - 9.26~dfsg+0-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
libgs9-common - 9.26~dfsg+0-0ubuntu0.18.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ghostscript package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '9.26~dfsg+0-0ubuntu0.18.04.1').
